result.description: Initial version of the Data management plan that defines the management of project data lifecycle It will bookkeep the data collected processed and generated in the project propose and maintain the methodology and standards applied in the process propose and supervise data curation and preservation and define handling of the research data during and after the project

result.title: Revised iFLEX consumer engagement and incentive mechanisms
result.description: This deliverable will present in a series of three versions on M08 M18 and M31 the development of the incentive and consumer engagement mechanisms of the project These mechanisms will cover both the economic compensation of consumers for their participation in DR as well as their social priorities altruism nonmonetary incentives etcBesides adequate compensation ensuring participation of consumers the analysis will also address fairness issues ie develop means ensuring that the benefits from DR be fairly allocated among the various participants

result.title: Initial iFLEX consumer engagement and incentive mechanisms
result.description: This deliverable will present in a series of three versions on M08 M18 and M31 the development of the incentive and consumer engagement mechanisms of the project These mechanisms will cover both the economic compensation of consumers for their participation in DR as well as their social priorities altruism nonmonetary incentives etcBesides adequate compensation ensuring participation of consumers the analysis will also address fairness issues ie develop means ensuring that the benefits from DR be fairly allocated among the various participants

result.title: Initial Automated flexibility management module
result.description: Initial Automated flexibility management module realized with a rule-based control system to verify the actions proposed by the AI-based optimization module. The rule-based control also includes mechanisms to take over when the DRL algorithm is not confident about the right action.

result.title: Recommendations Ship & Shore Interfaces
result.description: Design Recommendations for the Current Direct Waterborne Transport Battery's Ship and Shore Interfaces will clearly describe verifiable, independent performance, safety, and cost requirements. Certain requirements will be specified as Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The requirements will synthesize inputs from suppliers, operators, classification societies, governments, and recyclers. They are the output of T2.3 and T2.4.

result.title: CHEK GHG emissions simulator
result.description: A greenhouse gas emissions calculator will be made available through the project website, allowing users to simulate emissions savings using various actions or technologies. The final emissions calculator will be submitted in the form of a spreadsheet (Excel) or program. Refers to task: T10.4 Implementing dissemination activities (WMU, LR, All) M5-M36

result.title: Summary of communication and dissemination
result.description: This deliverable reports the summary of the communication and dissemination activities realised in the project CHEK in the following categories: 1. Three e-lessons created an published via open access (refers to T10.4), 2. Eight peer-reviewed journal articles for paving the way for result exploitation by making the stakeholders and scientific community aware of research results available for further research and for prospective new products into the market (refers to: T2.4, T3.5, T4.3, T5.1, T5.2, T5.4, T5.6, T6.4, T7.3, T7.4, T8.1, T8.2, T9.3, T2.2), 3. Presentation of the results at least 15 conferences, seminars or webinars ( refers to T10.4), 4. Three workshops at maritime academies for result dissemination to seafarers (refers to T10.4), 5. The Info paper presented to the IMO Marine Environmental Protection Committee (MEPC) (refers to T10.4), 6. Four workshops for shipyards , two for cruise yards and two for merchant vessel (refers to T10.5), 7. Workshop for ship-owners/credit specialists/European Community Shipowners Association (ECSA) on the new power by the hour business model (refers to T10.5,), 8. Workshop with DG CLIMA/MOVE (refers to T10.4), 9. Press statements on project progress every six months (refers to T10.3), 10. Report on clustering and liaising with other relevant RDI projects and also other initiatives at European context (refers to T10.6).

result.title: Project Website
result.description: The CHEK project website will be developed by WMU to communicate the latest news on the project, and disseminate relevant project files such as videos and project reports. The website will have worldwide visibility when live. Refers to task: T10.3 Implementing communication activities and promoting of a coherent project identity among stakeholders and its project website (WMU, All) M5-M36

result.title: Cost comparison for the fuel options
result.description: Document the estimates of supply costs of the fuel options considered in the project and the relevant timescales 2030 2050 including comparisons The costs will be used as input to other tasks within the project If successful this will not only provide the cost asumptions to be used in the project but will also provide clear description and understanding of the methodologysources used to obtain the costs to enable comparison and review in the future Refers to task T82
